name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's classic novel of a lawyer in the Deep South defending a black man charged with the rape of a white girl. It's a poignant exploration of racial injustice and moral growth.

George Orwell's dystopian masterpiece, 1984, is a prophetic and haunting tale of a totalitarian regime, where Big Brother watches your every move. A powerful commentary on the dangers of government overreach.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's timeless novel offers a witty exploration of the predicaments of love and marriage in 19th-century England, centered around the intelligent and spirited Elizabeth Bennet.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's novel tells the story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City, who is living in a world that he finds phony and hypocritical.

name: Brave New World
description: Aldous Huxley's novel presents a dystopian future where society is technologically advanced, but human values have been sacrificed for stability and control.

name: Moby Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic saga of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale Moby Dick, a powerful exploration of humanity and the unfathomable sea.

name: Crime and Punishment
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's psychological drama delves deep into the mind of a poor St. Petersburg student who plans to commit a random murder and justify his actions.

name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: Mark Twain's novel follows young Huck Finn and a runaway slave as they journey down the Mississippi River, a powerful depiction of American life in the 19th century.

name: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's prelude to the Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit, is an enchanting story of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on an unexpected journey filled with danger and treasure.

name: Frankenstein
description: Mary Shelley's groundbreaking novel tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a grotesque but sentient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.
